column4: What would cause fglrxinfo to give me a "Xlib:  extension "ATIFGLRXDRI" missing on display ":0.0". " segmentation fault?
the phase of the moon?
Anything i could control?
yes, jaunty uses X1.6 so only catalyst 9.5 will work with it at the moment
Ah i thought so. Thanks.
have you looked at http://cchtml.com?
yes. Following those instructions three times yesterday i wound up with 3 different errors on 3 fresh installs of jaunty
I used to follow the manual installation instructions (they got balinghup's ati card working last night!)
It seems to have finally settled on the segmentation error
when you did the manual install did you you install the 3 .deb packages specifically listed or did you install all 6 created when you did --buildpkg ?
I didn't install the -dev package, I installed all the others
Last one i think, is synaptic the best way to uninstall the packages or is there a cleaner way
I use dpkg to install/remove local packages and apt for repository packages
I see. Thanks.
but they are basically equivalent
you might try purging them
I'm new, how would i do that? -p?
dpkg --purge <package names>
Roger. For future reference what's the difference between purge and remove
purge removes config files as well as the binaries
Is "Xlib:  extension "ATIFGLRXDRI" missing on display ":0.0". " really so vague an error that it could be the phase of the moon?
my experience with the fglrx drivers is that no error was specific enough to no be affected by the gravitational pull of my pet cat
Are there any tricksy ways to disambiguate it?
